poem:
Title: The Unseen Ship 

Unseen is the ship, promised but bereft,
An echo in Gaza's lonesome tide.
A hunger gnaws the heart, a beggar's theft,
as famine finds its home, unsurprised.
No aid arrives, no salvation seen,
Only the stark, abandoned morning,
The scorned dawn of an empty dream,
In a world where no poet's warning 
Can stay the hollow hand, or break the silent mourning.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Aid ‘still not reaching Gaza’, as top US official warns famine has started A surge in aid into Gaza that Benjamin Netanyahu promised Joe Biden a week ago has so far failed to materialise, aid workers say, as the US aid chief confirmed that famine was beginning to take hold in parts of the besieged coastal strip. A key port has not been opened to aid shipments, and a new crossing into northern Gaza has". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
